p: Antioxidants are substances that neutralize the adverse effects of oxidative stress [ 146], and they may be either natural or synthetic. Natural antioxidants are generally preferred by consumers by virtue of the potential health risks of synthetic antioxidant consumption [ 147]. Plants and different plant parts such as flowers, stems, and roots may be the source of natural antioxidants, including polyphenols, carotenoids, and vitamins. The EOs of these plants exhibit antioxidant activity apart from several biological activities such as antimicrobial, anticancer, anti-inflammatory, and anti-aging [ 148, 149].
